poem:
### The Furniture Maker

In the denim dusk  
of East London,  
a raconteur  
named Andy—  
unforgettable,  
like carved oak dreams—  
spun tales  
with the rich patina  
of life's quirks,  
his words  
gilding the moment  
like sunlight  
on a polished chair;  
there,  
stories sat  
and stayed.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘He was unforgettable’: the mesmerising star of cult documentary Andy the Furniture Maker It was 1982 and young film-maker Paul Oremland was in an east London leather and denim pub, about to meet a character who would change his life. “Andy was pretty unforgettable,” recalls Oremland. “Full of amazing tales, and with a wealth of knowledge about people, places and quirky London life.” Oremland had been talking to the fledgling Channel 4 about making a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
